intro: Erysimum anceps, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erysimum anceps is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
